cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 mi W of Barbados and 75 mi E of St. Vincent
cyclone.trajectory: tracking rapidly west-northwest across the eastern Caribbean, forecast to skirt the southern coast of Hispaniola Saturday, move near Jamaica Sunday, cross or graze Cuba Monday, then emerge in the eastern Gulf and curve toward the Florida peninsula and Big Bend Tuesday–Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend / northern Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for Florida at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for Florida at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, especially Gulf side, with outer bands possible along the east-central Atlantic coast including Port Canaveral
weather_observation.wind: Low to moderate chance (≤19%) of sustained 34–45 kt winds late Tuesday into early Wednesday; gusty squalls possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Atlantic side of east-central Florida based on present track and intensity forecast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain with locally higher amounts up to 4 inches possible in outer rainbands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes or waterspouts in outer rainbands cannot be ruled out.
